toy-projects.name: Conway's Game of Life
toy-projects.description: Conway's game of life implemented in JavaScript with React. Mobile-first, responsive.

toy-projects.name: Simple Calculator
toy-projects.description: A basic calculator written in vanilla JavaScript and css. This project was created using test driven development with jest. Floating point arithmatic not yet supported. Originally created for desktop only, the calculator should now display on mobile too.

toy-projects.name: Simon Game
toy-projects.description: A clone of the electronic game Simon with sound and lights! Desktop only: not responsive or mobile friendly.

applications.name: App-Trax
applications.description: A react application that provides simple job search tracking. Currently under development. One of my deeper dives into testing with jest and enzyme.

applications.name: Newsy
applications.description: A web client for searching the newsapi.org api. Provides a simple interface to the many search options available. Uses a simple express server to act as an api-key providing proxy to the newsapi.org site.

applications.name: HotkeyCommander
applications.description: A javascript module, published to npm, that provides a drop-in, robust hotkey management system with simple end-user customization through hotkey recording and event subscriptions. This is the hotkey engine that powers JackBeNimble.

applications.name: JackBeNimble
applications.description: A google chrome extension that provides sophisticated, user-configurable order-entry hotkeys for multiple bitcoin exchanges. Easily extensible to more. This project was used extensivly by me, and after being published to the chrome web store, it did pick up a small number of users. As better options for crypto-exchange hotkeys emerged, I stopped maintaining the package, and pulled it from the store.

applications.name: FlyptoX
applications.description: A full-featured cryptocurrency exchange written in Node.js. Developed using the 'agile' method, the project was developed by a remote team of 5 over the course of about 5 weeks during which I worked as 'project owner' and full stack developer.
